summary: This document is an email chain from December 2018 between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel discussing a request for notes and records from a 2016 meeting with Peter Skinner. The chain includes a forwarded 2016 email from Peter Skinner, a lawyer, who shares a news article about Jeffrey Epstein and introduces attorney Sigrid McCawley as a lead attorney on the case, attaching legal documents for review.

persons.name: Peter Skinner
persons.context: He is the sender of the original 2016 emails, forwarding a news article about Jeffrey Epstein, introducing attorney Sigrid McCawley, and attaching legal case documents (complaint, declarations, Rule 56.1 statement, redacted 302) for review by the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: Introduced by Peter Skinner as one of the lead attorneys on the case involving Jeffrey Epstein, with knowledge of the facts. Her email is added to the chain.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in a forwarded 2016 news article link about his continued relationships with young women and his East Side mansion housing 'Russian playmates'. He is the central subject of the legal case discussed.

connections.description: Skinner introduces McCawley as a lead attorney on the Epstein case and includes her in the email chain, indicating a working legal relationship.
Skinner is communicating about legal case documents (complaint, declarations, 302) related to Epstein, strongly implying he is part of the legal team involved in matters concerning Epstein.
McCawley is identified as a lead attorney on the case involving Jeffrey Epstein, indicating a direct attorney-client or legal representative relationship.

events.title: Page Six Reports on Epstein's Relationships
events.description: The New York Post's Page Six reports on Jeffrey Epstein's continued relationships with young women and his East Side mansion housing 'Russian playmates'.

events.title: Meeting and Document Transfer
events.description: Peter Skinner meets with U.S. Attorney's Office personnel and follows up by email, attaching key legal documents related to the Epstein case for their review.

events.title: Request for Meeting Notes
events.description: U.S. Attorney's Office personnel request notes and records from the 2016 meeting with Peter Skinner and ask about any further meetings related to Epstein.

keyFacts: In March 2016, media (Page Six) was reporting on Jeffrey Epstein's continued associations with young women, specifically mentioning his East Side mansion.

Attorney Peter Skinner was in communication with the U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) in 2016, providing them with legal case documents including a complaint, declarations, a Rule 56.1 statement, and a redacted FBI 302 form related to Epstein.
Sigrid McCawley is identified in 2016 as a lead attorney on the Epstein case with deep knowledge of the facts.
In December 2018, the U.S. Attorney's Office was actively seeking to recover notes and records from their 2016 meeting with Skinner, indicating an ongoing investigative interest.
